intro: Bothriospermum bicarunculatum, commonly known as the two-lobed spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy, yellowish bracts. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, with the distinctive two-lobed structure giving it its scientific name. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
